And from thereafter <WG1537> <WG5127> Pilate <WG4091> sought <WG2212> to release <WG630> him: but the Jews <WG2453> cried <WG2896> out, saying, <WG3004> If <WG1437> you let <WG630> this <WG5126> man go, <WG630> you are <WG1488> not Caesar's <WG2541> friend: <WG5384> whoever <WG3956> <WG3588> makes <WG4160> himself <WG848> a king <WG935> speaks <WG483> against <WG483> Caesar. <WG2541>

After <WG3326> this, <WG5124> Jesus <WG2424> knowing <WG1492> that all <WG3956> things were now <WG2235> accomplished, <WG5055> that the scripture <WG1124> might be fulfilled, <WG5048> said, <WG3004> I thirst. <WG1372>
